thread.title: Halloween asteroid to 'shave past' Earth
thread.title_full: Halloween asteroid to 'shave past' Earth | News24

author: news24.com
title: Halloween asteroid to 'shave past' Earth
text:
Miami - A big asteroid is hurtling toward Earth and will shave past our planet on Halloween, but astronomers say there's no need to be spooked - it's definitely not on a collision course.
Early estimates put its size of the asteroid - called 2015 TB145 - at about 470m in diameter, according to the astronomy website Earth and Sky.
It is expected to be the largest known cosmic body to get near our planet until 2027, said the US space agency Nasa.
"If the size is correct, the new found asteroid is 28 times bigger than the Chelyabinsk meteor that penetrated the atmosphere over Russia in February 2013," Earth and Sky said.
